content.description: Glycogen synthetase kinase 3 beta is a protein kinase that has been implicated in many types of cancer. Depending on the cell type, the gene for glycogen synthetase kinase 3 beta <math alttext="G S K 3 beta" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="italic"><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mo>(</mo></mrow></mstyle><mi>G</mi><mi>S</mi><mi>K</mi><mn>3</mn><mi>β</mi><mstyle mathvariant="normal"><mrow><mo>)</mo></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> can act either as an oncogene or as a tumor suppressor.
content.question: Which of the following best predicts how <math alttext="G S K 3 beta" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="italic"><mrow><mi>G</mi><mi>S</mi><mi>K</mi><mn>3</mn><mi>β</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> mutations can lead to the development of cancer?

choices.label: Cells with inactive <math alttext="G S K 3 beta" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="italic"><mrow><mi>G</mi><mi>S</mi><mi>K</mi><mn>3</mn><mi>β</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> fail to trigger apoptosis.

Cells with inactive <math alttext="G S K 3 beta" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="italic"><mrow><mi>G</mi><mi>S</mi><mi>K</mi><mn>3</mn><mi>β</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> fail to proceed past the <math alttext="G 2 slash M" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><msub><mrow><mtext>G</mtext></mrow><mrow><mn>2</mn></mrow></msub><mtext>/M</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> checkpoint.

Cells with overactive <math alttext="G S K 3 beta" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="italic"><mrow><mi>G</mi><mi>S</mi><mi>K</mi><mn>3</mn><mi>β</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> are more likely to repair <math alttext="D N A" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mtext>DNA</mtext></mrow></mstyle></math> damage.

Cells with overactive <math alttext="G S K 3 beta" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="italic"><mrow><mi>G</mi><mi>S</mi><mi>K</mi><mn>3</mn><mi>β</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> have longer cell cycles.

content.answer: Cells with inactive <math alttext="G S K 3 beta" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mstyle mathvariant="italic"><mrow><mi>G</mi><mi>S</mi><mi>K</mi><mn>3</mn><mi>β</mi></mrow></mstyle></mrow></mstyle></math> fail to trigger apoptosis.

skill.text: 6.E: Predict the causes or effects of a change in, or disruption to, one or more components in a biological system.
